Navigate to other release versions of Doxee Platform Process Designer

[6.6](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/process-designer-6-6)

[6.7](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/process-designer-6-7)

All general workbench actions available through the menu, toolbar or shortcuts are summarized here, including the locations where to find them. The availability and exact behaviour of the actions contained in the category *Edit* may depend on the active editor or view and the selection within.

## Close
#### ![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAABAAAAAQCAYAAAAf8/9hAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAARnQU1BAACxjwv8YQUAAAAJcEhZcwAADsMAAA7DAcdvqGQAAAAnSURBVDhPYxgFgxk4ODj8hzJR2CQBkEZCmpmgNPUBVbwwCugCGBgAu/MKfUti86gAAAAASUVORK5CYII=) Usage: *File* menu
Closes the currently active editor tab. If there are unsaved changes a dialog will ask if the changes should be saved.

## Close All
![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAABAAAAAQCAYAAAAf8/9hAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAARnQU1BAACxjwv8YQUAAAAJcEhZcwAADsMAAA7DAcdvqGQAAABTSURBVDhPYxj6gBFKg4GDg8N/KJPhwIEDRMvBAbIiXABdDROUJhvgNADZJmJcBgboCkF8bGJQJhhQ7AUUgGw6MWwMgFcSCtDVUOwF6iakoQgYGAB7pyh9WE6UJwAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==) **Usage:** *File* menu

Closes all open editor tabs.

## Close Others
![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAABAAAAAQCAYAAAAf8/9hAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAARnQU1BAACxjwv8YQUAAAAJcEhZcwAADsMAAA7DAcdvqGQAAABRSURBVDhPYxj6gBFKMzg4OPyHMhkOHDgAF0cGxKhBUYQOsMkxQWmyAU4DkG3D5yoMgK6RkEEUewEDwGzBZjM2F2AAfIqwyVHsBeonpKEGGBgAe6cofVT7LywAAAAASUVORK5CYII=) **Usage:** *File* menu

Closes all open editor tabs except for the one currently active.

## Copy
![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAABAAAAAQCAYAAAAf8/9hAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAARnQU1BAACxjwv8YQUAAAAJcEhZcwAADsMAAA7DAcdvqGQAAABhSURBVDhPY2TAARwcHP5DmeQBkAGEAEgNE1Q92YCRWKfu378fykIAR0dH4p2KDVDFC6MGDAYDwAkJWyJBBuAEgwsQm5BsbGzsoVpQAHW8AGXjBX/+/HE4cuTIQSgXChgYAJ59lAwOxsZyAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC) **Usage:** *Edit* menu, toolbar

Put the selection to the clipboard.

## Cut
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** *Edit* menu, toolbar

Cut selection and put it to the clipboard.

## Delete
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** *Edit* menu, toolbar Delete the selected element.

## Edit Perspective
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** toolbar

Switches the workbench to the edit perspective. This shows the views and applies the workbench layout associated with the perspective.

## Execute Process
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** *Process Engine* menu, toolbar

If a launch configuration for the active process has already been executed in the current session, the same configuration will be started again. Otherwise the *Launch Configurations *dialog opens with a default launch configuration selected for the process of the currently active editor. The dropdown next to the toolbar button provides the latest launch

configurations of the active process for direct execution and an entry for opening the *Launch Configurations* dialog. For further information about executing processes see the chapter [Execute Process](/doxee-platform/docs/6-6-process-designer-process-designer-user-guide-process-execution).

## Exit
![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAABAAAAAQCAYAAAAf8/9hAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAARnQU1BAACxjwv8YQUAAAAJcEhZcwAADsMAAA7DAcdvqGQAAABmSURBVDhPYxhwwAilUYCDg8N/KBMrOHDgAFZ9cIDPAHQ5JihNNqC9AYTCA6sB6IGEzxCwQkK2wADIYJBagrGADEAakC1AtwyrF9AV4bORYCASci7to5EQwBkLuJyOrJak2MAOGBgAIoQoz4q9P5UAAAAASUVORK5CYII=) **Usage:** *File* menu

Exit and close the Process Designer workbench.

## Export Diagram
#### Usage: *File* menu
Opens a dialog for using the diagram export feature. This feature can be used to export the process diagram as an image. Use the radio buttons in *Figure* to switch between exporting the whole diagram or just the selected components if there is a selection. Use the combo box in *Image Format* to select an available format for the image file. When not using the SVG format, the size and scaling of the image can be defined in *Size*. Clicking *OK* opens a Resource Explorer dialog for specifying file name and location for the image.

## Launch Configurations
![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAABAAAAAQCAYAAAAf8/9hAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAARnQU1BAACxjwv8YQUAAAAJcEhZcwAADsMAAA7DAcdvqGQAAABnSURBVDhPvZBZCsAwCAVtT+bRvVmLRcQtzVY6PxHJG1T4BUS8pHQ1c8rbJAYY2+sKenwjqMaM8J/qn07QkhDRIaVie26FEUkUphuMrGNJgmrkN5xgNsyoYCXMPILVMJNuMMu2YBOAG7bQI5m2SPGLAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC) **Usage:** *Process Engine* menu

Opens the *Launch Configurations* dialog. For more information about launch configurations see the section [Launch Configurations](/doxee-platform/docs/6-6-process-designer-process-designer-user-guide-process-execution#launch-configurations)

## Layout Process
#### Usage: *Layout* menu
Automatically creates layout information for the process in the currently open editor and applies this layout, replacing the old one. The behaviour of this feature can be configured in the preferences in *Automatic Layout Configuration*.

## Mapping Layout
#### Usage: *Data* menu
Opens a dropdown list for selecting a layout for displaying mappings and mapping placeholders in the editor when data mode is active. More details about data mode can be found in section [Data Mode](/doxee-platform/docs/6-6-process-designer-process-designer-user-guide-data-mode-1).

## New Process
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** *File* menu, toolbar

Opens a new, empty process. This process is not persisted until the user saves it. A not yet persisted process has the title *new_Process* instead of the file name in the header of the editor tab.

## Open File
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** *File* menu, toolbar

Opens a Resource Explorer dialog where the file to be opened can be selected. Apart from files in the Infinica Process Definition (IPD) format, Process Designer can also open text files.

> Note

Process Definitions have their own IPD version number. The current IPD version occasionally changes when there are significant changes in the IPD format between versions of the Doxee Platform. Process Designer can automatically migrate processes from an older version to the current one. When an old IPD version is opened, the user will see a prompt which informs about the version difference. The prompt always offers the options to migrate the process or cancel loading the process. In cases where the process can be opened in the old version, this option is available as well, but it is recommended to always migrate older processes before making any changes.

## Open Log File
**Usage:** *File* menu

Opens the Process Designer log file from its local workspace.

## Open Web GUI
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** *Process Engine* menu

Opens an embedded browser as an editor tab, containing the web interface of the Process Engine currently selected in the combo box in the toolbar.

## Paste
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** *Edit* menu, toolbar

Paste the content of the clipboard.

## Print
#### ![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAABAAAAAQCAYAAAAf8/9hAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAARnQU1BAACxjwv8YQUAAAAJcEhZcwAADsMAAA7DAcdvqGQAAABuSURBVDhP3ZPRCsAgCEVr+FnC8svzzzYuSEtmxNbL2HnRyG55pZw6mHknIrVliKq6Mw4IlFKOEdiz0sZm8TUfEkB/MwMB6novll+QI2drrZZ5RMSyi1DgCT8Y47KJNyA4IrpsvQWLjdlY/XdO6QSxUVEdIHYibQAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==) Usage: *File* menu
Opens the dialog for printing the content of the currently open editor. If that is a process diagram editor, the dialog offers configuration options for the diagram. Use the radio buttons in *Figure* to switch between printing the whole diagram or just the selected components if there is a selection. The options in *Size* can be used to either fit the diagram size to the page, scale the image or provide a custom size. In *Position* the exact position can be defined or set to put the diagram in the center. The unit of measurement can be switched between centimeters and inches in *Units*. Use the *Change Printer* button to define a printer, *OK* for printing or *Cancel* to abort.

## Redo
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** *Edit* menu, toolbar

Redo the last undone change.

## Refresh Engine
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Ort:** Symbolleiste

Reloads all information provided by the Process Engine selected in the toolbar (status, activities, tasks, data types).

## Save
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** *File* menu, toolbar

Saves the file open in the currently active editor tab. If the editor tab contains a new process which has not been persisted yet, a Resource Explorer dialog for defining the file name and location is opened. Only available if changes have been made in the active editor.

## Save All
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** *File* menu, toolbar

Saves the files from all open editor tabs. Only available if changes have been made in one of the open editors.

## Save As
#### ![](data:image/png;base64,) Usage: *File* menu
Opens a Resource Explorer dialog for saving the file open in the currently active editor tab under a new name and/or location.

## Select All
**Usage:** *Edit* menu

Select all available elements.

## Select Process Engine
**Usage:** Toolbar

Available as combo box in the toolbar. Selects one of the Process Engine configurations defined in *Preferences*. The selected engine will be used for retrieving the available activity modules for the palette.

## Show Notes
**Usage:** *Layout* menu

Show or hide the note elements and note connections in the process diagram.

## Show Warnings
#### Usage: *Layout* menu
Show or hide the warning and error icons in the upper right corner of process elements where the automatic validation has found problems.

## Start/Stop Engine
![](data:image/png;base64,) /![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAABAAAAAQCAYAAAAf8/9hAAAAAXNSR0IArs4c6QAAAARnQU1BAACxjwv8YQUAAAAJcEhZcwAADsMAAA7DAcdvqGQAAABrSURBVDhPY6AUMEJpFPBGRuU/lIkCRJ7cwVCPIoBLIzpANgjOIFYzDMAMYQLzKABgU0i1HQZArsBpAHqA4VID98JvKE0qoDgM4AawQmlSAXUCEQQGNh3AALGuQI5iFANgAJdB6GmDCoCBAQCuJikU1VDqigAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)      **Usage:** *Process Engine* menu, toolbar

Starts/Stops the Process Engine selected in the combo box in the toolbar. Is only available for managed (local) installations of the Process Engine.

## Test Perspective
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** toolbar

Switches the workbench to the test perspective. This shows the views and applies the workbench layout associated with the perspective.

## Toggle Data Mode
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** *Data* menu, toolbar

Activate and deactivate data mode for the currently active editor. Only available if an editor is open and active. More details for data mode can be found in section [Data Mode](/doxee-platform/docs/6-6-process-designer-process-designer-user-guide-data-mode-1).

## Toggle Grid
**Usage:** *Layout* menu

Show or hide the grid lines in the editor area.

## Undo
![](data:image/png;base64,) **Usage:** *Edit* menu, toolbar Revert the last change.

## View
**Usage:** *View* menu (action has the name of the view)

For each available view in the Process Designer there is an action with the same name in the menu category *View*. These actions open the view with the specified name. For further information about views see the chapter [Views](/doxee-platform/docs/6-6-process-designer-process-designer-user-guide-views).

## Zoom
**Usage:** Toolbar

Zoom in and out of the editor area. Can be changed via the smaller combo box in the toolbar, containing percentage values.
